alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 3:50AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Crittenden, DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, northeastern Tunica and Shelby Counties through 430 AM CST... At 348 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Horseshoe Lake, or 10 miles east of Hughes, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Millington, T O Fuller State Park, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Walls, Horseshoe Lake, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Ellendale and Eudora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
